text: The Philadelphia Inquirer’s top editor, Stan Wischnowski, has resigned days after an article headlined “Buildings Matter, Too” led dozens of staff members to walk out https://t.co/5q4Gqa6Enl

name: nytimes
text: RT @dougmillsnyt: Protesters gather along “Black Lives Matter Plaza” just down the street from the White House. https://t.co/ycOfnD7HWM

name: nytimes
text: Researchers say more targeted approaches to coronavirus shutdowns — in New York and elsewhere — might have protected public health with less economic pain https://t.co/5abEJ67Tb8

name: nytimes
text: RT @EricSchmittNYT: EXCLUSIVE: Top Pentagon officials ordered National Guard helicopters' aggressive response against protesters on a chaotic Monday night in D.C. @tmgneff https://t.co/QAJZGxJmkY

name: nytimes
text: Several top Republicans won’t support President Trump’s re-election — and some might vote for Joe Biden. They’re debating how open to be about it. https://t.co/55Peq87kMD

name: nytimes
text: RT @emmabgo: I wrote about the peculiar American tradition of politician commencement speeches. From JFK to LBJ and Obama, political leaders have used graduation ceremonies to talk to a country in crisis. What's the class of 2020 missing out on? https://t.co/rG9Y9dOzfK

name: nytimes
text: Demonstrations across the U.S. grew larger and more organized on Saturday, with passionate crowds taking to the streets in a mass protest movement against systemic racism https://t.co/1NClVhFt5f

name: nytimes
text: “One of Japan’s most visible responses has been near-universal mask wearing, seen here as a responsible thing to do to protect oneself and others, and as a small price to pay to be able to resume some semblance of normalcy,” writes @motokorich https://t.co/ko1EVEmApa

name: nytimes
text:
Demonstrators on Saturday marched from Brooklyn to Manhattan, and back to Brooklyn again as protests continued in New York City.

Read the latest from New York here. https://t.co/xrdQ9yt4Vj https://t.co/NEwWwoZvQ3

name: nytimes
text: Demonstrators booed Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey out of a rally on Saturday after he declined to commit to defunding the police. Read more about the protests in the U.S. here. https://t.co/zHv8ocIPXj https://t.co/8WPMnyFXjP

name: nytimes
text: The U.S. Marine Corps on Friday issued detailed directives about removing and banning public displays of the Confederate battle flag at Marine installations, including on items such as mugs, posters and bumper stickers https://t.co/Qw5PddWBaA
